OPERATIONS.
SECRET.
G.T.2844
From:- General Radcliffe, Italy.
To:- C.I.G.S, War Office.
Handed in 9 a.m. 2nd December, 1917.
Received 2.12 p.m. 2nd December, 1917.
10010 December 1st. Following is situation evening.
3rd Army. Persistent though light artillery fire especially on 11th Corps front at Zenzon and Lampol. Minor enemy attempts to cross Piave near Noventa failed. Enemy's Dracken brought down in flames by aeroplane.
4th Army. During last night considerable enemy artillery activity in the region of Col della Beretta Mt. Asalone and Mt. Grappa. Morning December 1st Italians attempted to retake lost position on Mt. Pertica. After fierce fighting enemy remained in possession though slight progress was made. Enemy artillery fairly active about Monte Tomba and Pallone.
1st Army. Lively enemy artillery action against Italian position between the Astico and Brenta noticeably at Casera Magna Boschi, Mount Lemerle and Carriola basin.
During night enemy reconnoitring parties advanced against Maletta Davanti and Mount Fior but were stopped by artillery fire. Considerable aerial activity of whole of 1st Army front.
